[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The County Portal (CP) defines requirements for managing applications, permits, inspections, and property records.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CP supports tracking, inspections, payments, notifications, and reports.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CP integrates with GIS, payment gateways, and email services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CP provides dashboards for applicants, inspectors, and admins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CP operates on cloud and on-prem servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CP integrates with PostgreSQL, GIS, and repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CP secures API access via OAuth 2.0, TLS 1.3, and rate limiting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CP processes large geospatial datasets efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CP ensures nearly always uptime with backups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CP supports zoning laws and workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CP connects with GIS, repositories, and logs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CP manages applications, permits, inspections, reports, and transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CP is designed for applicants, inspectors, and admins with RBAC.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CP depends on external data, availability, and regulations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CP assumes compliance with building codes, zoning laws, and security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with GIS for permit tracking and geospatial updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall process payments and encrypted notifications via TLS 1.3 and secure API access via OAuth 2.0, TLS 1.3, and rate limiting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to submit, track, and update applications and permits (REQ-DB-001, REQ-SEC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable inspectors to schedule and log inspections with digital signatures (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide dashboards with RBAC (REQ-USAB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface with MFA.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process updates in 3s and support several thousand users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store data with AES-256 and audit trails.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR, ISO 27001, NIST, and encrypt data using AES-256 and TLS 1.3.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO cybersecurity and data protection standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce RBAC with MFA for authentication and enforce API rate limiting (about a hundred requests/min per user).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure nearly always uptime with failover and cryptographic logging.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Audits, penetration tests, and compliance checks.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System architecture, security policies, and compliance reports.
[SEC] 5. References: GDPR, ISO 27001, NIST, OAuth 2.0, PCI-DSS, and GIS documentation.
